sentences.english: Then she sat upon a settee and watched the people dance.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在一只有靠背的长椅上，看大家跳舞。

sentences.english: If you'd help me move this bench into the shade, I'd greatly appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你帮我把这把长椅搬到阴影下，我会很感激你的。

sentences.english: A long upholstered bench placed against or built into a wall.
sentences.chinese: 软长椅靠墙放置或安在墙上的软型长凳。

sentences.english: But those people are usually on a bench or under a tree.
sentences.chinese: 不过这些人一般都是睡在长椅上或者树下。

sentences.english: They will play for a park bench or a tree to help remember a person.
sentences.chinese: 他们会买下公园里一个长椅，或一棵树来记住一个人。

sentences.english: On secluded benches around West Lake, one often sees courting couples.
sentences.chinese: 在沿湖隐蔽的长椅上，你常常会看到一对对恋人。

sentences.english: At the end, I sat on a bench where I started.
sentences.chinese: 散完步后，我坐到起步处的一张长椅上。

sentences.english: He chatted with a vendor at the candle shop and leaned against the park bench.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在公园的长椅上，和一个腊烛店的店主聊天。

sentences.english: The oak bench was not just a foot rest.
sentences.chinese: 橡木长椅不仅仅是歇脚的地方。

sentences.english: In the ambulance, she was put down on a bench opposite her husband.
sentences.chinese: 在急救车里，她跟丈夫面对躺卧在两侧长椅上。

sentences.english: I sit poised in my pew. No screaming or wailing.
sentences.chinese: 我镇静地坐在教堂的长椅上，没有尖叫，没有哀号。

sentences.english: Go higher on a bench or low table in the next skateboard manual move.
sentences.chinese: 在接下来的滑板手移动的长椅上高或低表。

sentences.english: Gan woodenly awoke sitting up in front of the bench, and then suddenly started running.
sentences.chinese: 醒来的甘木然坐在门前的长椅上，然后突然开始奔跑。

sentences.english: The center was filled with seats a subull craptantiald the two rear wingls were lined with roundproof-glbumm-enclosed cubbyholes.
sentences.chinese: 这里在在都是长椅，玻璃文件架排成了后头的两堵墙。

sentences.english: To feel, and a pair of lilac on the bench and sat down.
sentences.chinese: 走累了，就在丁香丛中的长椅上坐了下来。

sentences.english: She was lying on a small settee in the parlor.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在客厅的一张小长椅上。

definition: to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
sofa (loanword)/CL:條|条[tiao2],張|张[zhang1]/(Internet slang) the first reply or replier to a forum post
